content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Pretty simple and interesting. I think it can be a good candidate for the reverse mode as well

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well done, could work for code size mode too

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It works well and isn't too complicated.

Thank you for making the changes.

Goal section
* Please add indentation to the two examples.

Output section
* For simplification, suggest to replace the whole section with:
[[N]] lines: The table as specified in Goal section.

Cases
* There are two cases with input of 5. Please revise them so that they are different.

Thanks again.

Output section
* Suggest to replace the whole section with:
[[N]] lines: The enumeration table as specified in Goal section.

Goal section
* Please format N as a variable.

* Suggest to change "format specified below" to "table format as follows:".

* Suggest to add:
• The table should consist of [[N]] lines, i.e. line 1 to line [[N]].
• Every line should contain [[N]] multiples of the line number, starting with <<line number squared>>, e.g.
   • Line 1 should start with 1 * 1 = 1, and the subsequent multiples of 1 i.e. 2, 3, ... up to [[N]].
   • Line 2 should start with 2 * 2 = 4, and the subsequent multiples of 2 i.e. 6, 8, ... up until there are [[N]] numbers in this line.
• All numbers on the same line should be space-separated.

Constraints section
* Please remove the second constraint as it just repeats what has been stated in Input section.

Cases
* There are duplicate validators. Please revise them so that all the cases are different.

Thanks.

Modified. 
However for duplicate case, for input above 17, the output is truncted, thus cannot verify.
Due to the less amount of available case, there is a possibility for people to find the answer by hand (And use if-else), instead of doing it the proper way. That's why I kept the constrain to 10^9.

Although it's a good idea, I generally don't prefer Shortest Mode since it basically means you can only use python and other coding language that offers short code size. In this clash I only wanted to test the player's iteration skills.

Thank you.

By indentation I don't mean line breaks. I mean leading spaces. You still have to fix that for better readability.

I don't understand what you mean by "proper way"?

There should not be duplicate cases. I think you have sufficient pairs of tests and validators, so you may remove one pair and replace one of the "5 test" with one of the removed cases.

I also don't understand what you mean for the reason of constraint of 10^9 on N. Actually the constraint is more like 1 ≤ N ≤ 100, because N refers to the input number only, not the output.
Proper way refers to the use of loops and conditions. By hand refers to calculating it directly on paper and using an if-else to print the corresponding answer. 1 <= N <= 100 is fine as well.

I doubt whether people would do so, and even if they do so, they won't be able to type so many numbers more quickly than other players who solve them "properly".

Also, there is a character limit in the solution. It'll be tricky to fit all the solutions in the solution.

So, don't worry about that, please just revise the duplicate cases.

Thanks.
